dcterms:creator: Nicolas Bourdis
Denis Marraud
H. Sahbi
dcterms:description: The Jefferson dataset consists of 2,200 non-overlapping patch pairs (of 30 Ã— 30 RGB pixels each) corresponding to registered (bi-temporal) GeoEye-1 satellite images taken from the area of Jefferson (Alabama) in 2010 and 2011. The dataset includes multiple changes due to tornadoes as well as no-changes, making the task of finding relevant changes challenging.
dcterms:title: Jefferson dataset

dcterms:creator: Xia Gui-Song
et al.
dcterms:description: Object-DOTA is a large-scale dataset for object detection in aerial images, containing 127,759 remote sensing snapshots belonging to 15 categories. The images were taken from 2,806 large remote sensing images, both in gray-scale and RGB, with dimensions ranging from 8002 to 20,0002 pixels.
dcterms:title: Object-DOTA
